channel.title: Comments on: Recover a database without the ldf file
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Jason Clark
item.dc:creator: Jason Clark
item.description: DBCC REBUILD_LOG does not exist in SQL Server 2005. The DB will not always come up as status SUSPECT. this is No longer Works on SQL 2005 or you can use ALTER DATABASE yourdb SET EMERGENCY. or you can do this by using SQL Server Management studio. Take a look on this blog <a href="http://www.sqlserverlogexplorer.com/how-to-attach-mdf-file-without-ldf-file/" rel="nofollow">http://www.sqlserverlogexplorer.com/how-to-attach-mdf-file-without-ldf-file/</a>
item.content:encoded: DBCC REBUILD_LOG does not exist in SQL Server 2005. The DB will not always come up as status SUSPECT. this is No longer Works on SQL 2005 or you can use ALTER DATABASE yourdb SET EMERGENCY. or you can do this by using SQL Server Management studio. Take a look on this blog http://www.sqlserverlogexplorer.com/how-to-attach-mdf-file-without-ldf-file/

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.description: Ada, tempdb is the only database that gets recreated every time SQL gets restarted
item.content:encoded: Ada, tempdb is the only database that gets recreated every time SQL gets restarted

item.title: By: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.dc:creator: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.description: Sense the TempDB is set in simple recovery, it will automatically create a new ldf file so there is no need for recovery.
item.content:encoded: Sense the TempDB is set in simple recovery, it will automatically create a new ldf file so there is no need for recovery.

item.title: By: Ada
item.dc:creator: Ada
item.description: What if the db with missing ldf was tempdb?<br />
item.content:encoded: What if the db with missing ldf was tempdb?

item.title: By: Gail Shaw
item.dc:creator: Gail Shaw
item.content:encoded:
I wrote a blog post a couple months back on recovering a DB without log file when the DB was not shut down cleanly. http://sqlinthewild.co.za/index.php/2009/06/09/deleting-the-transaction-log/

Is kinda a fun excercise, if the DB in question doesn’t mean anything, that is.
